intro: Ptychoraphis intermedia, commonly known as the yellow false indigo, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces legumes that contain seeds. Ptychoraphis intermedia is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
